sources.title: Borrowed Hero
sources.description: Title: Borrowed Hero Summary: Roger Andrews, an assistant district attorney, is the accidental hero of a police capture that results in his appointment by crooked civic leaders as a special prosecutor assigned to smash ... Directed by: Lewis D. Collins Actors: Production Company: A.W. Hackel Productions Release Date: 5 December 1941 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Roger Andrews, an assistant district attorney, is the accidental hero of a police capture that results in his appointment by crooked civic leaders as a special prosecutor assigned to smash a crime ring. The crooked politicians, in an effort to cover their own tracks, work to turn public sympathy against him but, aided by newspaper-reporter Ann Thompson and informant Carol Turner, he adopts gangland's own methods in getting a confession for the ring's hired killer.

sources.title: Borrowed Hero
sources.description: A Monogram film featuring Alan Baxter and Florence Rice.

sources.title: Borrowed Hero (1941) CRIME DRAMA
sources.description:
Stars: Alan Baxter, Florence Rice, Constance Worth
Director: Lewis D. Collins

A young prosecutor in the DA's office begins to suspect that a "civic reform" organization may actually be a front for the city's organized crime ring!

metadata.Plot: Roger Andrews, an assistant district attorney, is the accidental hero of a police capture that results in his appointment by crooked civic leaders as a special prosecutor assigned to smash a crime ring. The crooked politicians, in an effort to cover their own tracks, work to turn public sympathy against him but, aided by newspaper-reporter Ann Thompson and informant Carol Turner, he adopts gangland's own methods in getting a confession for the ring's hired killer.
metadata.Writer: Ben Roberts, Sidney Sheldon, Earle Snell
metadata.Actors: Alan Baxter, Florence Rice, Constance Worth
